We will create a visualization to show how the body mass of penguins differs by island and by sex.

# We start by grouping by island and sex and finding the median body mass of penguins for each category combination.
penguins_by_island = penguins.groupby(["Island", "Sex"])["Body Mass (g)"].median()
penguins_by_island

Island     Sex   
Biscoe     .         4875.0
           FEMALE    4587.5
           MALE      5350.0
Dream      FEMALE    3450.0
           MALE      3950.0
Torgersen  FEMALE    3400.0
           MALE      4000.0
Name: Body Mass (g), dtype: float64



import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# We will create a bar plot that groups by Island and Sex and shows the median body mass of the penguins.

# We plot the bars for the median body mass of female penguins by island, as calculated above.
plt.bar(X_axis - 0.2, [4587.5, 3450, 3400], 0.4, label = 'Female') 
# We plot the bars for the median body mass of male penguins by island, as calculated above.
plt.bar(X_axis + 0.2, [5350, 3950, 4000], 0.4, label = 'Male') 
  
plt.xticks([0,1,2], ["Biscoe", "Dream", "Torgersen"]) 
plt.xlabel("Island") 
plt.ylabel("Median Body Mass of Penguins") 
plt.title("Body Mass of Penguins by Island and Sex") 
plt.legend() 
plt.show() 








As we can see from the visualization, Biscoa island has penguins with higher body mass than Dream island and Torgersen island. Also, male penguins on average have a greater body mass that female penguins on each island.
